verses.verse: After <WH310> this opened<WH6605> Job<WH347> his mouth<WH6310>, and cursed<WH7043> his day<WH3117>.
And Job<WH347> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>:
Let the day<WH3117> perish<WH6> wherein I was born<WH3205>, And the night<WH3915> which said<WH559>, There is a man-child<WH1397> conceived<WH2029>.
Let that day<WH3117> be darkness<WH2822>; Let not God<WH433> from above<WH4605> seek<WH1875> for it<WH5105>, Neither let the light shine upon it<WH3313>.
Let darkness<WH2822> and the shadow of death<WH6757> claim<WH1350> it for their own<WH6053>; Let a cloud dwell<WH7931> upon it<WH3650>; Let all that maketh black the day<WH3117> terrify it<WH1204>.

As for that night<WH3915>, let thick darkness<WH652> seize<WH3947> upon it<WH2302>: Let it not rejoice among the days<WH3117> of the year<WH8141>; Let it not come<WH935> into the number<WH4557> of the months<WH3391>.
Lo <WH3915>, let that night be barren<WH1565>; Let no joyful voice<WH7445> come therein<WH935>.
Let them curse<WH5344> it that curse<WH779> the day<WH3117>, Who are ready<WH6264> to rouse up<WH5782> leviathan<WH3882>.
Let the stars<WH3556> of the twilight<WH5399> thereof be dark<WH2821>: Let it look<WH6960> for light<WH216>, but have none<WH7200>; Neither let it behold the eyelids<WH6079> of the morning<WH7837>:
Because it shut not up<WH5462> the doors<WH1817> of my mother<WH990>'s womb, Nor hid<WH5641> trouble<WH5999> from mine eyes<WH5869>.
Why died<WH4191> I not from the womb<WH7358>? Why did I not give up the ghost<WH1478> when my mother<WH990> bare me<WH3318>?
Why did the knees<WH1290> receive<WH6923> me<WH7699>? Or why the breast, that I should suck<WH3243>?
For now should I have lain down<WH7901> and been quiet<WH8252>; I should have slept<WH3462>; then had I been at rest<WH5117>,
With kings<WH4428> and counsellors<WH3289> of the earth<WH776>, Who built<WH1129> up waste places for themselves<WH2723>;
Or with princes<WH8269> that had gold<WH2091>, Who filled<WH4390> their houses<WH1004> with silver<WH3701>:
Or as a hidden<WH2934> untimely birth<WH5309> I had not been<WH5768>, As infants that never saw<WH7200> light<WH216>.
There the wicked<WH7563> cease<WH2308> from troubling<WH7267>; And there the weary<WH3019> are at rest<WH5117>.
There the prisoners<WH615> are at ease<WH7599> together<WH3162>; They hear<WH8085> not the voice<WH6963> of the taskmaster<WH5065>.
The small<WH6996> and the great<WH1419> are there<WH5650>: And the servant is free<WH2670> from his master<WH113>.
Wherefore is light<WH216> given<WH5414> to him that is in misery<WH6001>, And life<WH2416> unto the bitter<WH4751> in soul<WH5315>;
Who long<WH2442> for death<WH4194>, but it cometh not<WH2658>, And dig for it more than for hid treasures<WH4301>;
Who rejoice<WH8056> exceedingly<WH1524>, And are glad<WH7797>, when they can find<WH4672> the grave<WH6913>?
Why is light given to a man<WH1397> whose way<WH1870> is hid<WH5641>, And whom God<WH433> hath hedged in<WH5526>?
For my sighing<WH585> cometh<WH935> before<WH6440> I eat<WH3899>, And my groanings<WH7581> are poured out<WH5413> like water<WH4325>.
For the thing which I fear<WH6342> cometh<WH857> upon me<WH3025>, And that which I am afraid of cometh unto me<WH935>.
I am not at ease<WH8252>, neither am I quiet<WH8252>, neither have I rest<WH8252>; But trouble<WH7267> cometh<WH935>.
